intro: Barnadesia arborea, commonly known as the tree barnadesia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stem and large, palmately lobed leaves. Its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in clusters. Barnadesia arborea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils with ample sunlight.
